summary: Studies show physician practices have increasingly been acquired by hospital systems, insurance companies, private equity firms, and other entities. At least 47% of physicians were consolidated with hospital systems in 2024—up from less than 30% in 2012. Studies show this consolidation can increase spending and prices, with one finding significant increases for office visits occurring in hospitals. Care quality may be the same or lower...
title: Health Care Consolidation: Published Estimates of the Extent and Effects of Physician Consolidation
